This is a small restaurant and a bar, right by the sea. They have 2 floors. Prices are affordable. Gamini works here and he is very attentive. If you want to have alcohol or food with a nice view by the sea, this is a...nice location in Mount-Lavinia. Would definitely visit aga nice location in Mount-Lavinia. Would definitely visit again.

This is a perfect place for dining with very tasty food & BIG portions! Lots of different food - pretty local as well - we were amazed üñ§ Enjoy your food directly ON the beach & with very friendly staff! The price is also amazing...- we will return  - we will return ü•∞ü§òüèº

Ate here each night of our 3 night stay in Mount Lavinia. Just as good as we remembered from 2016.
Great staff, great food and reasonable priced wine and beer. Devilled cuttlefish was particularly good. One night there was a private party and when it...rained at the end of our meal the host invited us in. So even the customers were love rained at the end of our meal the host invited us in. So even the customers were lovely.

Ordered a pepper pork which was super tasty, ideal place to chill with a beer and of course the stunning view of the ocean, friendly staff, The building seems a bit rundown and with a little bit of renovation JoJo‚Äôs could offer quite a compelling...produ product.
the shack provide beach bed , beach table , changing room , drinks on economical rate . excellent service with clean seating arrangement

A Tuk Tuk driver took me to this place. He highly recommended this place, later I realised he was right. Fresh seafood specially marinated fish with local spices, jumbo prawns were superb. Had beers right on the nice beach enjoying the sunset, it was a...really chilling memorable experience. price was reasonable. Staff was really friendly and ready to serve you at anytime. Be careful about the rail tracks next to the restaurant specially when you get drunk. Thanks JoJo's pl really chilling memorable experience. price was reasonable. Staff was really friendly and ready to serve you at anytime. Be careful about the rail tracks next to the restaurant specially when you get drunk. Thanks JoJo's place

Basic but nicely located with tables right on the beach. The menu is well priced and includes a range of noodle and rice dishes plus a smattering of western offerings. Portions are very large and one dish will do two people. We took chicken chop...sues and rice and it was very well cooked.  Good place for grabbing lunch on the bea sues and rice and it was very well cooked.  Good place for grabbing lunch on the beach.

if you want to just go and chill, sip on a cold brew or even take your prefered spirits (the hard types), then I'd say this is the best laid-back place on Mount Beach. 

But don't just go for the cold brew... or to savour...your favourite spirits that you'd like to take with you. Go through their menu and you'll find quite a variety to sink your teeth into, or to satisfy your cravings for a nice and spicy 'bite'. If you're Sri Lankan, you know how important 'bites' are, and the immeasurable role it plays in complementing our drinking :-)... If you are one of those bite-people, Jo Jo's is the place on the beach... (I mean if you really know and love your bites).

It's not to say that their choice of mains (if I may call it so) are poor, they are a league of their own. We all know what a good Chinese-Sri Lankan style Chop Suey is... these guys have gone one step further and given it a more flavourful spin (at least that is what 'Z' (Z is one of the partners... who knows his food) told me one evening. I do agree that they've added a little magic of their own, to this ever-popular Chinese 'rice'. But that's not all. They've got more. 

The good thing is, when you give your order, tell one of the boya taking the order how you want your spice and they'll do the best with your request. The batter fried stuff are quite crunchy and they spicy stuff are just fiery in a kind of tantalising way. 

By the way, it doesn't mean Jo Jo's is only for the guys & gals who want to sip a brew or down a few shots. It's also a charming setting, to just go out for a chilled out dinner with someone close or your family. 

Next time you hit Mount beach, not visiting Jo Jo's would be such a was your favourite spirits that you'd like to take with you. I do agree that they've added a little magic of their own, to this ever-popular Chinese 'rice'. But that's not all. They've got more. 

The good thing is, when you give your order, tell one of the boya taking the order how you want your spice and they'll do the best with your request. The batter fried stuff are quite crunchy and they spicy stuff are just fiery in a kind of tantalising way. 

By the way, it doesn't mean Jo Jo's is only for the guys & gals who want to sip a brew or down a few shots. It's also a charming setting, to just go out for a chilled out dinner with someone close or your family. 

Next time you hit Mount beach, not visiting Jo Jo's would be such a waste!
The staff is very friendly and the Kottu was very good. Even though it‚Äôs right next to the beach, the prices are very reasonable.
Visited JoJo‚Äôs Place for dinner on the weekend. Their food was super delicious. And the portions were large and enough for 2. Highly recommend this Jem on Mount Lavinia beach.

My dinner was very nice. The soup and prawns were delicious and a very generous portion of everything. The staff is very friendly. Fast service. Great view on the beach. Good prices. Really recommend!

Since I was last here, the cheap beach places have all gone, together with some of the expensive ones, leaving mostly mid-range. JoJo‚Äôs is typical of these, pleasant enough but nothing to get excited about. All these places have identikit menus, the usual fish, chicken,...beef and squid dishes for around 700LKR. Some of them then ramp up the cost by charging up to 450 for a portion of steamed rice, all have sky-high beer prices (often not listed on the menu) and all add 10%, so the final bill can turn out a bit more than you were expecting.

At Jojo‚Äôs the food is OK, the generous portion of rice moderately priced and the beer as overpriced as everywhere else. In the evening they ruin the tranquil atmosphere, sound of waves, etc. by playing a local radio station at high volume so you get random music or, half the time, someone talking. Service was pretty quick when I was there, but I was the only diner ‚Äì there seems a general lack of punters in this area nowadays.

I wouldn‚Äôt particularly recommend eating on Lavinia Beach at all, but if you want to, JoJos is as good as the various more expensive places listed on TA. If you can't find somewhere quieter, it‚Äôs not a bad choice. If you can, the quality will likely be about the sam beef and squid dishes for around 700LKR. Some of them then ramp up the cost by charging up to 450 for a portion of steamed rice, all have sky-high beer prices (often not listed on the menu) and all add 10%, so the final bill can turn out a bit more than you were expecting.

At Jojo‚Äôs the food is OK, the generous portion of rice moderately priced and the beer as overpriced as everywhere else. In the evening they ruin the tranquil atmosphere, sound of waves, etc. by playing a local radio station at high volume so you get random music or, half the time, someone talking. Service was pretty quick when I was there, but I was the only diner ‚Äì there seems a general lack of punters in this area nowadays.

I wouldn‚Äôt particularly recommend eating on Lavinia Beach at all, but if you want to, JoJos is as good as the various more expensive places listed on TA. If you can't find somewhere quieter, it‚Äôs not a bad choice. If you can, the quality will likely be about the same..
Simple but good and affordable stay directly at the sea, straight from Blue Seas GH. Great upper dininghall too viewing over the ocean.

We found JoJo's while walking along the beach. Good food, friendly staff and nice ocean view. I told the waiter I wanted my food EXTRA SPICY. He went back and told the cook and they made it spicy. Boy, did they make it spicy. It...was aweso was awesome.

We stayed in a guest house close to the Mount Lavinia beach on the 1st of January and we were advised by the host to just walk few meters and find a beachfront restaurant. The closest restaurant was packed and we walked few more meters...and located Jo Jo‚Äôs bar/restaurant. It was also full, but the nice waiters brought a table and chairs for us to be very close to water.

It was the full moon and the moonlit beach and festive atmosphere‚Äîfamilies frolicking in water and occasional fireworks flying over the ocean‚Äîmade it a very special evening. 
Humorously, they did not serve beer because full moon was a religious holiday, but they did not mind opening a bottle of wine for us. The food we ordered‚Äîdeviled fish, kotthu, fish & chips & kankung‚Äîalso tasted very good. 

All in all, it was a great evening at Jo Jo and located Jo Jo‚Äôs bar/restaurant. It was also full, but the nice waiters brought a table and chairs for us to be very close to water.

It was the full moon and the moonlit beach and festive atmosphere‚Äîfamilies frolicking in water and occasional fireworks flying over the ocean‚Äîmade it a very special evening. 
Humorously, they did not serve beer because full moon was a religious holiday, but they did not mind opening a bottle of wine for us. The food we ordered‚Äîdeviled fish, kotthu, fish & chips & kankung‚Äîalso tasted very good. 

All in all, it was a great evening at Jo Jo‚Äôs.

I did not stay at the hotel, only came by for dinner and drinks on the terrace. I strongly recommend this for tourists. It‚Äôs a beautiful terrace and the history of the hotel is incredible. Worth the visit!
Nice location to chill, food was great especially the desserts, staff were nice but not everyone was proactive, great value for money, had a surprise visit from a squirrel too üòÑ

Excellent location, atmosphere and food.... great table/waiter service from Viraj as well - very professional, helpful and pleasant - makes a huge difference for a hotel stay. Lovely old Colonial style and elegance.More
Food is too spicy and no taste apart from burning your mouth because its too hot. Dirty sea area view.More
Great spot to see the sunset over the Ocean, happy hour is well worth it, try a Beer Tower if there are say four of you.More

Thank you very much for your excellent service all the time. Specailly, I would like to thanks Terrace restaurant manger Mr. Nilantha led by other staff. Nilantha hanks again always care of us and we always enjoy terrace with your excellent staff. all the best....hope to visit again next july. Shinkai from Ja hope to visit again next july. Shinkai from Japan

I have been coming to my favorite Hotel Mount Lavinia for 20 years. Unfortunately, the level has fallen massively for some time. Catastrophic service. I waited 20 minutes again at a table on the terrace. While greeted remotely by a waiter, no menu, no drink....After 20 minutes gone. And that the menu I know well from before is no longer different from pizza fast food restaurants is simply unworthy of this ho After 20 minutes gone. And that the menu I know well from before is no longer different from pizza fast food restaurants is simply unworthy of this hotel

Terrible, terrible, terrible and none of waiter wants to serve you nor is the quality of food is good. Be ready to fall sick and wait in eternity for your food/ drinks to arrive. Even if served, then you are blessed person for the day....Rude and arrogance is the buzz word of this restaurant Rude and arrogance is the buzz word of this restaurant!!!

This is a great spot to sit as the sun goes down and see the beachfront.  The breeze and setting is beautiful.  Totally recommend.  It can be busy, so do book in advance.  The food is very good, Sri Lankan type which includes curry, rice...dishes and medium spice.  They have a great range.  You can also order western food too.  The staff are a little slow at getting drinks out, I had to ask a waiter twice, waiting over 20 minutes for a coke.  It's a great spot for couples as it gets dark, not so much for us with a toddler.  We ate inside night 2.  Do try, it's love dishes and medium spice.  They have a great range.  You can also order western food too.  The staff are a little slow at getting drinks out, I had to ask a waiter twice, waiting over 20 minutes for a coke.  It's a great spot for couples as it gets dark, not so much for us with a toddler.  We ate inside night 2.  Do try, it's lovely.
What a lovely location and the setting was just perfect for our anniversary dinner! But managed by barely 3 men who were running down to serve!!! majorly understaffed!!More
The view of the pool and sea is excellent. The food same as the Governes  restaurant. The service O K.More

Unfortunately this Terrace is not exclusively for Hotel guests only so can become really cowed + overrun.

It can feel like it‚Äôs a public pool area, not what you‚Äôd expect when staying here.

Families come for lunch, many children are in supervised + run riot....Unpleasant.

The terrace itself is lovely.

The management need to re think acce Unpleasant.

The terrace itself is lovely.

The management need to re think access.
Lovely place to have a glass of wine, gaze into the city skyline and listen to the waves at night...some days you get live music as wel.
Great choice of food, always cooked perfectly or you can just have a drink if you wish.  With views over to Colombo and amazing sunsets
The terrace of the Mount Lavinia Hotel offers an amazing sea view and als a great view on the city of colombo. Watching the sun set with while having a cocktail is very enjoyable and relaxing.
